title: Narendra Modi addresses rally at Banka; says poor must use facilities of banks
text:
Narendra Modi addresses rally at Banka; says poor must use facilities of banks By India.com News Desk on October 2, 2015 at 4:24 PM Comments Dumka, Jharkhand, Oct 2: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressing the election rally at Bamka in Bihar on Friday said that poor of the country must use the facilities available in banks. Addressing thousands he said that he will stand by the people of Bihar shoulder to shoulder in developing the face of Bihar. Encouraging more people to use banks, he said, ”Opening the doors of banks was not enough for us. We want the poor to make use of the facilities that the banks have to offer.” Talking about the benefits of banks, he said that banks will free people from shaukars (lenders). He said, “We are empowering people for whom banks were shut, the people who never imagined they would be free from clutches of sahukars.” He added saying that if people of Bihar give him the honor of being one, he will what we are doing for Bihar is not a favor, its your right and you gave me the honor of being the one to give it.” Stating that India’s progress is not possible without the progress of Bihar, the Prime Minister said the Central Government had opened its coffer for the state’s progress. ”The government has emptied its coffers for Bihar’s development, and this is no favour, this is Bihar’s and its peoples’ right,” he added. (Also Read: Narendra Modi pay tributes to Mahatma Gandhi, Lal Bahadur Shastri on birth anniversary) He also said that Bihar will celebrate two Diwalis this year - one after the poll results are out, while the other on the day of the festival. Bihar elections will be five phase election held from October 12 to November 5.
